tasks.task: Researching and advising farmers on combining inoculant with seed-applied pesticides for legume crops.
subtasks: Identifying toxic pesticides (e.g., thioram, ppct) that affect inoculant bacteria.
Recommending separation of inoculant from fungicide-treated seeds (e.g., furrow application, different timing).
Highlighting the importance of proper inoculant dosage, prompt sowing, and favorable soil moisture.
Advising farmers to sow into paddocks with prior legume growth to enhance nodulation.

tasks.task: Conducting field trials to evaluate the impact of pesticides on legume nodulation.
subtasks: Applying various treatments (fungicide-coated seeds, inoculant application timing) in controlled field trials.
Monitoring nodulation and nitrogen fixation in treated plots.
Analyzing results to determine the effects of pesticide stress and dry soil on inoculant efficacy.
